results.title: Gourmet Fish Cooking
results.brief_description: This excellent video provides viewers with an easy to follow step by step guide to gourmet fish cooking. International chef, Peter Jarmer, passes on the tricks of the trade in selecting and filleting fish, cooking techniques and the art of exquisite presentation. Rated: G

results.title: Good housekeeping: for men only
results.brief_description: A safety film for employees in the building industry. Shows how to increase efficiency and reduce accidents by proper use and storage of materials and by taking proper precautions in the course of the building activities.

results.title: Gold the sacred metal
results.creator_credit: Jeri Sopanen, Lewis Bushnell and Kena Productions
results.brief_description: This film is about gold and what people will do for and with it. For gold, the Conquistadors waged wars and with their superior weapons defeated the Latin American Indians. The film shows the descendants of these Indians, the Koguis, who still survive in small villages. Twice a year they dance with golden masks.

results.title: Glooscap country
results.brief_description: Ancient legend of the Micmac Indians of Nova Scotia. The rich scenic panorama of Nova Scotia’s Minas Basin gives substance to the story of Glooscap, an Indian God who was believed to live on what is now Cape Blomidon and from his mountain retreat to watch over his people in the valleys and forests below.

results.title: Give us a go
results.creator_credit: Diane Charleson and Materials Production, Education Dept for Equal Opportunity Board
results.brief_description: An explanation of the functions of the Equal Opportunity Board as it relates to the disabled. Various examples of discrimination are shown together with re-enactments showing conciliation and Board hearings.

results.title: Getting down to earth
results.creator_credit: Richard Reinhardt, William Bronson, Denver Sutton and Wine Advisory Board
results.brief_description: The goddess Daphne decends to California (with backup help from Bacchus) to help restaurant staff promote and sell more wine with meals. Emphasizes effective presentation of wines and the virtues of California wines.
